You peer through the dim light filtering through dusty windows. The library stretches before youâ€”towering shelves packed with ancient tomes, their spines cracked and faded. Dust motes drift lazily in the amber light.

A reading desk sits in the center, covered in open manuscripts. To your left, a rolling ladder leads up to the upper galleries. The air smells of old paper and leather.
